paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a pathogenic variant in the KCNH2 gene associated with long QT syndrome, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected family members.

patients.phenotype: LQT2 with varying QTc intervals and T-wave morphologies

individual_records.phenotype_details: QTc of 510 ms, deep negative T waves
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Our patient's QTc was 510 ms during rest.

individual_records.phenotype_details: QTc of 580 ms, low amplitude and notched T waves
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient's daughter had QTc of 580 ms.

individual_records.phenotype_details: QTc of 480 ms, low amplitude and notched T waves
individual_records.evidence_sentence: His son also had QTc of 480 ms.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is considered the cause of the disease due to the frameshift and early stop codon according to the 'mutation taster' evaluations.

variants.segregation_data: The same variant was detected in all three family members.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on mutation type and family segregation
variants.additional_notes: The mutation was previously unidentified but classified as pathogenic.
key_quotes: According to the genetic report, although the mutation detected in the KCNH2 gene is a previously unidentified mutation, it was considered as the cause of the disease due to the frameshift and early stop codon according to the 'mutation taster' evaluations.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
